types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: slackIssueCreated

fields.name: slackIssueNewComment
fields.description: Whether to send a Slack message when a comment is created on any of the project or team's issues.

fields.name: slackIssueStatusChangedDone
fields.description: Whether to send a Slack message when any of the project or team's issues change to completed or cancelled.

fields.name: slackIssueAddedToView
fields.description: Whether to send a Slack message when an issue is added to the custom view.

fields.name: slackIssueStatusChangedAll
fields.description: Whether to send a Slack message when any of the project or team's issues has a change in status.

fields.name: slackProjectUpdateCreated
fields.description: Whether to send a Slack message when a project update is created.

fields.name: slackProjectUpdateCreatedToTeam
fields.description: Whether to send a new project update to team Slack channels.

fields.name: slackProjectUpdateCreatedToWorkspace
fields.description: Whether to send a new project update to workspace Slack channel.

fields.name: slackInitiativeUpdateCreated

fields.description: Whether to send a Slack message when a new issue is added to triage.

fields.name: slackIssueSlaBreached

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was created.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description:
The last time at which the entity was meaningfully updated. This is the same as the creation time if the entity hasn't
    been updated after creation.

fields.name: archivedAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was archived. Null if the entity has not been archived.

fields.name: number
fields.description: The issue's unique number.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The issue's title.

fields.name: priority
fields.description: The priority of the issue. 0 = No priority, 1 = Urgent, 2 = High, 3 = Normal, 4 = Low.

fields.name: estimate
fields.description: The estimate of the complexity of the issue..

fields.name: boardOrder
fields.description: The order of the item in its column on the board.
fields.deprecationReason: Will be removed in near future, please use `sortOrder` instead

fields.name: sortOrder
fields.description: The order of the item in relation to other items in the organization.

fields.name: prioritySortOrder
fields.description: The order of the item in relation to other items in the organization, when ordered by priority.

fields.name: startedAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue was moved into started state.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue was moved into completed state.

fields.name: startedTriageAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue entered triage.

fields.name: triagedAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue left triage.

fields.name: canceledAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue was moved into canceled state.

fields.name: autoClosedAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue was automatically closed by the auto pruning process.

fields.name: autoArchivedAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue was automatically archived by the auto pruning process.

fields.name: dueDate
fields.description: The date at which the issue is due.

fields.name: slaStartedAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue's SLA began.

fields.name: slaMediumRiskAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue's SLA will enter medium risk state.

fields.name: slaHighRiskAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue's SLA will enter high risk state.

fields.name: slaBreachesAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue's SLA will breach.

fields.name: slaType
fields.description: The type of SLA set on the issue. Calendar days or business days.

fields.name: addedToProjectAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue was added to a project.

fields.name: addedToCycleAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue was added to a cycle.

fields.name: addedToTeamAt
fields.description: The time at which the issue was added to a team.

fields.name: trashed
fields.description: A flag that indicates whether the issue is in the trash bin.

fields.name: snoozedUntilAt
fields.description: The time until an issue will be snoozed in Triage view.

fields.name: suggestionsGeneratedAt
fields.description: [Internal] The time at which the most recent suggestions for this issue were generated.

fields.name: activitySummary
fields.description: [Internal] The activity summary information for this issue.

fields.name: labelIds
fields.description: Id of the labels associated with this issue.

fields.name: team
fields.description: The team that the issue is associated with.

fields.name: cycle
fields.description: The cycle that the issue is associated with.

fields.name: project
fields.description: The project that the issue is associated with.

fields.name: projectMilestone
fields.description: The projectMilestone that the issue is associated with.

fields.name: lastAppliedTemplate
fields.description: The last template that was applied to this issue.

fields.name: recurringIssueTemplate
fields.description: The recurring issue template that created this issue.

fields.name: previousIdentifiers
fields.description: Previous identifiers of the issue if it has been moved between teams.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: The user who created the issue.

fields.name: externalUserCreator
fields.description: The external user who created the issue.

fields.name: assignee
fields.description: The user to whom the issue is assigned to.

fields.name: supervisor
fields.description: [DEPRECATED] [Internal] The user who has delegated this issue to be completed by an agent.

fields.name: delegate
fields.description: The agent user that is delegated to work on this issue.

fields.name: snoozedBy
fields.description: The user who snoozed the issue.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The workflow state that the issue is associated with.

fields.name: subIssueSortOrder
fields.description: The order of the item in the sub-issue list. Only set if the issue has a parent.

fields.name: reactionData
fields.description: Emoji reaction summary, grouped by emoji type.

fields.name: priorityLabel
fields.description: Label for the priority.

fields.name: sourceComment
fields.description: The comment that this issue was created from.

fields.name: integrationSourceType
fields.description: Integration type that created this issue, if applicable.

fields.name: botActor
fields.description: The bot that created the issue, if applicable.

fields.name: favorite
fields.description: The users favorite associated with this issue.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Issue's human readable identifier (e.g. ENG-123).

fields.name: url
fields.description: Issue URL.

fields.name: branchName
fields.description: Suggested branch name for the issue.

fields.name: customerTicketCount
fields.description: Returns the number of Attachment resources which are created by customer support ticketing systems (e.g. Zendesk).

fields.name: subscribers
fields.description: Users who are subscribed to the issue.

args.description: Filter returned subscribers.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The title of the issue.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The issue description in markdown format.

inputFields.name: descriptionData
inputFields.description: [Internal] The issue description as a Prosemirror document.

inputFields.name: assigneeId
inputFields.description: The identifier of the user to assign the issue to.

inputFields.name: delegateId
inputFields.description: The identifier of the agent user to delegate the issue to.

inputFields.name: parentId
inputFields.description: The identifier of the parent issue.

inputFields.name: priority
inputFields.description: The priority of the issue. 0 = No priority, 1 = Urgent, 2 = High, 3 = Normal, 4 = Low.

inputFields.name: estimate
inputFields.description: The estimated complexity of the issue.

inputFields.name: subscriberIds
inputFields.description: The identifiers of the users subscribing to this ticket.

inputFields.name: labelIds
inputFields.description: The identifiers of the issue labels associated with this ticket.

inputFields.name: teamId
inputFields.description: The identifier of the team associated with the issue.

inputFields.name: cycleId
inputFields.description: The cycle associated with the issue.

inputFields.name: projectId
inputFields.description: The project associated with the issue.

inputFields.name: projectMilestoneId
inputFields.description: The project milestone associated with the issue.

inputFields.name: lastAppliedTemplateId
inputFields.description: The ID of the last template applied to the issue.

inputFields.name: stateId
inputFields.description: The team state of the issue.

inputFields.name: referenceCommentId
inputFields.description: The comment the issue is referencing.

inputFields.name: sourceCommentId
inputFields.description: The comment the issue is created from.

inputFields.name: sourcePullRequestCommentId
inputFields.description: [Internal] The pull request comment the issue is created from.

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: The position of the issue related to other issues.

inputFields.name: prioritySortOrder
inputFields.description: The position of the issue related to other issues, when ordered by priority.

inputFields.name: subIssueSortOrder
inputFields.description: The position of the issue in parent's sub-issue list.

inputFields.name: dueDate
inputFields.description: The date at which the issue is due.

inputFields.name: createAsUser
inputFields.description: Create issue as a user with the provided name. This option is only available to OAuth applications creating issues in `actor=app` mode.

inputFields.name: displayIconUrl
inputFields.description: Provide an external user avatar URL. Can only be used in conjunction with the `createAsUser` options. This option is only available to OAuth applications creating comments in `actor=app` mode.

inputFields.name: preserveSortOrderOnCreate
inputFields.description: Whether the passed sort order should be preserved.

inputFields.name: createdAt
inputFields.description: The date when the issue was created (e.g. if importing from another system). Must be a date in the past. If none is provided, the backend will generate the time as now.

inputFields.name: slaBreachesAt
inputFields.description: [Internal] The timestamp at which an issue will be considered in breach of SLA.

inputFields.name: slaStartedAt
inputFields.description: [Internal] The timestamp at which the issue's SLA was started.

inputFields.name: templateId
inputFields.description: The identifier of a template the issue should be created from. If other values are provided in the input, they will override template values.

inputFields.name: completedAt
inputFields.description: The date when the issue was completed (e.g. if importing from another system). Must be a date in the past and after createdAt date. Cannot be provided with an incompatible workflow state.

inputFields.name: slaType
inputFields.description: The SLA day count type for the issue. Whether SLA should be business days only or calendar days (default).

inputFields.name: useDefaultTemplate
inputFields.description: Whether to use the default template for the team. When set to true, the default template of this team based on user's membership will be applied.

fields.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

fields.description:
The last time at which the entity was meaningfully updated. This is the same as the creation time if the entity hasn't
    been updated after creation.

fields.description: The time at which the entity was archived. Null if the entity has not been archived.

fields.name: readAt
fields.description: The time at when the user marked the notification as read. Null, if the the user hasn't read the notification

fields.name: emailedAt
fields.description:
The time at when an email reminder for this notification was sent to the user. Null, if no email
    reminder has been sent.

fields.description: The time at which a notification was unsnoozed..

fields.name: projectUpdateHealth

fields.name: groupingKey
fields.description: [Internal] Notifications with the same grouping key will be grouped together in the UI.

fields.name: groupingPriority
fields.description: [Internal] Priority of the notification with the same grouping key. Higher number means higher priority. If priority is the same, notifications should be sorted by `createdAt`.

fields.description: The bot that caused the notification.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was created.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description:
The last time at which the entity was meaningfully updated. This is the same as the creation time if the entity hasn't
    been updated after creation.

fields.name: archivedAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was archived. Null if the entity has not been archived.

fields.name: oauthClientId
fields.description: The uuid of the OAuth client being requested for installation.

fields.name: requesterId
fields.description: The person who requested installing the OAuth client.

fields.name: responderId
fields.description: The person who responded to the request to install the OAuth client.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status for the OAuth client approval request.

fields.name: scopes
fields.description: The scopes the app has requested.

fields.name: requestReason
fields.description: The reason the person wants to install this OAuth client.

fields.name: denyReason
fields.description: The reason the request for the OAuth client approval was denied.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was created.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description:
The last time at which the entity was meaningfully updated. This is the same as the creation time if the entity hasn't
    been updated after creation.

fields.description: The external user that caused the notification.

fields.description: The user that received the notification.

fields.name: readAt
fields.description: The time at when the user marked the notification as read. Null, if the the user hasn't read the notification

fields.name: emailedAt
fields.description:
The time at when an email reminder for this notification was sent to the user. Null, if no email
    reminder has been sent.

fields.name: snoozedUntilAt
fields.description: The time until a notification will be snoozed. After that it will appear in the inbox again.

fields.name: unsnoozedAt
fields.description: The time at which a notification was unsnoozed..

fields.description: The category of the notification.

fields.description: [Internal] URL to the target of the notification.

fields.name: title
fields.description: [Internal] Notification title.

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description: [Internal] Notification subtitle.

fields.name: isLinearActor
fields.description: [Internal] If notification actor was Linear.

fields.name: actorAvatarUrl
fields.description: [Internal] Notification avatar URL.

fields.name: actorInitials
fields.description: [Internal] Notification actor initials if avatar is not available.

fields.name: actorAvatarColor
fields.description: [Internal] Notification actor initials if avatar is not available.

fields.name: issueStatusType
fields.description: [Internal] Issue's status type for issue notifications.

fields.name: projectUpdateHealth
fields.description: [Internal] Project update health for new updates.

fields.name: groupingKey
fields.description: [Internal] Notifications with the same grouping key will be grouped together in the UI.

types.description: An organization. Organizations are root-level objects that contain user accounts and teams.

    been updated after creation.

inputFields.description: The identifier of the project to move the milestone to.

inputFields.name: newIssueTeamId
inputFields.description: The team id to move the attached issues to. This is needed when there is a mismatch between a project's teams and the milestone's issues' teams. Either this or addIssueTeamToProject is required in that situation to resolve constraints.

inputFields.name: addIssueTeamToProject
inputFields.description: Whether to add each milestone issue's team to the project. This is needed when there is a mismatch between a project's teams and the milestone's issues' teams. Either this or newIssueTeamId is required in that situation to resolve constraints.

inputFields.name: undoIssueTeamIds
inputFields.description: A list of issue id to team ids, used for undoing a previous milestone move where the specified issues were moved from the specified teams.

inputFields.name: undoProjectTeamIds
inputFields.description: A mapping of project id to a previous set of team ids, used for undoing a previous milestone move where the specified teams were added to the project.

fields.name: issueId
fields.description: The issue id in this relationship, you can use * as wildcard if all issues are being moved to the same team

fields.description: The team id in this relationship

types.name: Team
types.description: An organizational unit that contains issues.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was created.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description:
The last time at which the entity was meaningfully updated. This is the same as the creation time if the entity hasn't
    been updated after creation.

fields.name: archivedAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was archived. Null if the entity has not been archived.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The team's name.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The team's unique key. The key is used in URLs.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The team's description.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: The icon of the team.

fields.name: color
fields.description: The team's color.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: The organization that the team is associated with.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: [Internal] The team's parent team.

fields.name: children
fields.description: [Internal] The team's sub-teams.

fields.name: cyclesEnabled
fields.description: Whether the team uses cycles.

fields.name: cycleStartDay
fields.description: The day of the week that a new cycle starts.

fields.name: cycleDuration
fields.description: The duration of a cycle in weeks.

fields.name: cycleCooldownTime
fields.description: The cooldown time after each cycle in weeks.

fields.name: cycleIssueAutoAssignStarted
fields.description: Auto assign started issues to current cycle.

fields.name: cycleIssueAutoAssignCompleted
fields.description: Auto assign completed issues to current cycle.

fields.name: cycleLockToActive
fields.description: Auto assign issues to current cycle if in active status.

fields.name: upcomingCycleCount
fields.description: How many upcoming cycles to create.

fields.name: timezone
fields.description: The timezone of the team. Defaults to "America/Los_Angeles"

fields.name: inviteHash
fields.description: Unique hash for the team to be used in invite URLs.

fields.name: inheritWorkflowStatuses
fields.description: Whether the team should inherit its workflow statuses from its parent. Only applies to sub-teams.

fields.name: inheritIssueEstimation
fields.description: Whether the team should inherit its estimation settings from its parent. Only applies to sub-teams.

fields.name: issueEstimationType
fields.description: The issue estimation type to use. Must be one of "notUsed", "exponential", "fibonacci", "linear", "tShirt".

fields.name: issueOrderingNoPriorityFirst
fields.description: [DEPRECATED] Whether issues without priority should be sorted first.
fields.deprecationReason: This setting is no longer in use.

fields.name: issueEstimationAllowZero
fields.description: Whether to allow zeros in issues estimates.

fields.name: setIssueSortOrderOnStateChange
fields.description: Where to move issues when changing state.

fields.name: issueEstimationExtended
fields.description: Whether to add additional points to the estimate scale.

fields.name: defaultIssueEstimate
fields.description: What to use as a default estimate for unestimated issues.

fields.name: triageEnabled
fields.description: Whether triage mode is enabled for the team or not.

fields.name: requirePriorityToLeaveTriage
fields.description: Whether an issue needs to have a priority set before leaving triage.

fields.name: defaultIssueState
fields.description: The default workflow state into which issues are set when they are opened by team members.

fields.name: defaultTemplateForMembers
fields.description: The default template to use for new issues created by members of the team.

fields.name: defaultTemplateForMembersId
fields.description: The id of the default template to use for new issues created by members of the team.

fields.name: defaultTemplateForNonMembers
fields.description: The default template to use for new issues created by non-members of the team.

fields.name: defaultTemplateForNonMembersId
fields.description: The id of the default template to use for new issues created by non-members of the team.

fields.name: defaultProjectTemplate
fields.description: The default template to use for new projects created for the team.

fields.name: triageIssueState
fields.description: The workflow state into which issues are set when they are opened by non-team members or integrations if triage is enabled.

fields.name: private
fields.description: Whether the team is private or not.

fields.name: facets
fields.description: [Internal] Facets associated with the team.

fields.name: posts
fields.description: [Internal] Posts associated with the team.

fields.name: scimManaged
fields.description: Whether the team is managed by SCIM integration.

fields.name: scimGroupName
fields.description: The SCIM group name for the team.

fields.name: progressHistory
fields.description: [Internal] The progress history of the team.

fields.name: currentProgress

types.name: TimelessDate
types.description: Represents a date in ISO 8601 format. Accepts shortcuts like `2021` to represent midnight Fri Jan 01 2021. Also accepts ISO 8601 durations strings which are added to the current date to create the represented date (e.g '-P2W1D' represents the date that was two weeks and 1 day ago)

types.name: TimelessDateOrDuration
types.description: Represents a date in ISO 8601 format or a duration. Accepts shortcuts like `2021` to represent midnight Fri Jan 01 2021. Also accepts ISO 8601 durations strings (e.g '-P2W1D'), which are not converted to dates.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
